headline: Chili Colorado
name: Chili Colorado
description: Rich and hearty, this chunky Colorado pork chili gets its sizzle from chili powder and cumin. It simmers on the stovetop for two hours to intensify its flavor.
recipeIngredient: 1.5 pounds boneless pork, cut into 1 inch cubes
1 tablespoon bacon drippings, or vegetable oil
salt and black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Place 3 tablespoons flour in a plastic bag. Add pork and shake to lightly coat with flour; set aside.
Heat bacon drippings and vegetable oil in a Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add pork and cook until meat is evenly browned, about 5 to 8 minutes.

Stir in 1 tablespoon flour; cook and stir for 3 minutes. Stir in onion, tomato sauce, chili powder, cumin, garlic powder, salt, pepper, and water. Bring to a boil; reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until pork is just falling apart, about 1 1/2 to 2 hours.
